Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: Can you use a data type that specifies how many bits the type uses, e.g. uint8_t, instead of “long”? I think a long is different depending on the platform.

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: What? I disagree. Please remove this. Chromium and steam with their own window decorations should _definitely_ not be floating. For utility windows, the proper window type should be set.

Author: Tony Crisci
Comment: You are technically correct. I was on the fence about this because everything I tested displays much better when set to floating, except Chromium, which displays much better with i3 decorations.

Author: Tony Crisci
Comment: The problem with Motif hints is that they are used as a replacement for the proper types, and I can't find anything in the standard that explicitly mentions the concept of "floating" as distinct from "tiling".
